column4: Foxconn rejects Microsoft patent lawsuit  says never had to pay royalties
column5: TAIPEI Taiwan's Foxconn on Tuesday responded to a patent infringement lawsuit filed against it by Microsoft Corp  saying as a contract manufacturer  it has never needed to pay royalties for the U.S. company's software. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Foxconn rejects Microsoft patent lawsuit  says never had to pay royalties
column5: TAIPEI  March 12 Taiwan's Foxconn on Tuesday responded to a patent infringement lawsuit filed against it by Microsoft Corp  saying as a contract manufacturer  it has never needed to pay royalties for the U.S. company's software.

column4: Taiwan's Foxconn says unlikely to suffer loss from Microsoft lawsuit
column5: TAIPEI  March 12 Foxconn does not expect to suffer any loss as a result of a lawsuit filed by Microsoft Corp  the chief executive of the Taiwanese company  Terry Gou  said on Tuesday. Microsoft has said it is suing Foxconn  the contract manufacturer that rose to global prominence as assembler of the Apple iPhone  for what it claims are unpaid patent royalties.

column4: Elon Musk's defense of his Tesla tweet will get SEC response
column5: The top U.S. securities regulator received permission from a federal judge on Tuesday to respond to Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk's arguments that his Twitter post about the electric vehicle maker’s production volume did not violate his recent fraud settlement. | Video

column4: UPDATE 4-Elon Musk's defense of his Tesla tweet will get U.S. SEC response
column5: March 12 The top U.S. securities regulator received permission from a federal judge on Tuesday to respond to Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk's arguments that his Twitter post about the electric vehicle maker’s production volume did not violate his recent fraud settlement.

column4: U.S. regulator wants to reply to Musk in Tesla case
column5: March 12 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday asked a judge for permission to respond to arguments by Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk that his recent tweet about the electric vehicle maker’s production volume did not violate his fraud settlement and he cannot be held in contempt.

column4: Elon Musk shoots down U.S. regulator's complaint about his Tesla tweet
column5: SAN FRANCISCO - Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Elon Musk shot back against U.S. securities regulators on Monday  arguing in a filing that his recent tweet about the electric vehicle maker's production volume did not violate his fraud settlement and he cannot be held in contempt. | Video

column4: UPDATE 5-Elon Musk shoots down U.S. regulator's complaint about his Tesla tweet
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  March 11 - Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk shot back against U.S. securities regulators on Monday  arguing in a filing that his recent tweet about the electric vehicle maker's production volume did not violate his fraud settlement and he cannot be held in contempt.

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Stocks  pound rally as tweaked Brexit deal soothes investor worries
column5: * For Reuters Live Markets blog on European and UK stock markets please click on:

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Brexit deal changes propel pound  Asian shares higher
column5: SHANGHAI  March 12 The pound and Asian shares jumped on Tuesday after the European Commission agreed to changes in a Brexit deal before a vote in the British parliament on a divorce agreement that has unnerved financial markets over recent months.

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Pound soars  Asian shares rally after Brexit deal changes
column5: SHANGHAI  March 12 The pound jumped and Asian shares rallied on Tuesday after the European Commission agreed to changes in a Brexit deal ahead of a vote in the British parliament on a divorce agreement.

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Pound soars  Asian shares rally after Brexit deal changes
column5: SHANGHAI  March 12 The pound jumped and Asian shares rallied on Tuesday after the European Commission agreed to changes in a Brexit deal ahead of a vote in the British parliament on a divorce agreement.

column4: GLOBAL MARKETS-Pound jumps  Asian shares rise after changes to Brexit deal
column5: SHANGHAI  March 12 The pound jumped on Tuesday and Asian shares rose after the European Commission agreed to changes in a Brexit deal ahead of a vote in the British parliament on a divorce agreement.
